# https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/ llms.txt

## Azure Machine Learning Documentation

This file provides a structured overview of Azure Machine Learning documentation to help LLMs understand and reference Azure ML resources effectively.

## Core Azure ML Topics

### Getting Started
- [Azure Machine Learning Overview](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/overview-what-is-azure-machine-learning): Introduction to Azure Machine Learning service
- [Azure ML Quickstart](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/quickstart-create-resources): Create Azure ML workspace and resources
- [Azure ML Tutorial](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-azure-ml-in-a-day): Complete Azure ML tutorial for beginners

### Azure ML SDK v2
- [Azure ML SDK v2 Overview](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-v2): Understanding Azure ML SDK v2 architecture
- [SDK v2 Installation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-configure-cli): Install and configure Azure ML CLI v2
- [Python SDK v2 Guide](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/overview/azure/ml/intro): Azure ML Python SDK v2 documentation

### MLflow Integration
- [MLflow in Azure ML](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-mlflow): MLflow integration with Azure Machine Learning
- [MLflow Tracking](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-use-mlflow): Track experiments with MLflow in Azure ML
- [MLflow Models](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-deploy-mlflow-models): Deploy MLflow models in Azure ML

### Pipelines & Components
- [Azure ML Pipelines](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-ml-pipelines): Understanding ML pipelines in Azure
- [Create Components](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-create-component-pipeline-python): Build reusable pipeline components
- [Pipeline Jobs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-create-job-pipelines): Submit and manage pipeline jobs

### Data Management
- [Data Assets](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-data): Managing data in Azure ML
- [Datastores](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-datastore): Connect to storage services
- [Data Preparation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-create-register-data-assets): Create and register data assets

### Model Training
- [Train Models](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-train-model): Train ML models in Azure
- [Distributed Training](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-train-distributed-gpu): Distributed GPU training
- [Hyperparameter Tuning](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-tune-hyperparameters): Optimize model hyperparameters

### Model Deployment
- [Deploy Models](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-deploy-online-endpoints): Deploy models to online endpoints
- [Batch Endpoints](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-use-batch-endpoint): Deploy batch inference endpoints
- [Model Management](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-manage-models): Register and manage models

### Compute Resources
- [Compute Targets](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-compute-target): Azure ML compute options
- [Compute Clusters](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-create-attach-compute-cluster): Create compute clusters
- [Compute Instances](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-create-compute-instance): Development compute instances

### Environments
- [Azure ML Environments](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-environments): Reproducible ML environments
- [Create Environments](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-manage-environments-v2): Build custom environments
- [Environment Best Practices](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-environments-reproducibility): Environment reproducibility

### Monitoring & Logging
- [Monitor Models](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-monitor-online-endpoints): Monitor deployed models
- [Application Insights](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-enable-app-insights): Enable Application Insights
- [Data Drift](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-monitor-datasets): Detect data drift

### Security & Governance
- [Security Overview](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-enterprise-security): Enterprise security in Azure ML
- [Network Security](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-secure-workspace-vnet): Secure workspace with VNet
- [RBAC](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-assign-roles): Role-based access control

### Responsible AI
- [Responsible AI Dashboard](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai): Responsible AI tools
- [Model Interpretability](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-machine-learning-interpretability): Explain model predictions
- [Fairness Assessment](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-machine-learning-fairness-aml): Assess model fairness

### AutoML
- [AutoML Overview](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-automated-ml): Automated machine learning
- [AutoML for Classification](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-auto-train-models): Train classification models
- [AutoML for Time Series](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-auto-train-forecast): Time series forecasting

### Designer
- [Azure ML Designer](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-designer): Visual ML pipeline builder
- [Designer Modules](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/algorithm-module-reference/module-reference): Available designer modules
- [Designer Tutorial](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score): Designer tutorial

### CLI & Automation
- [Azure ML CLI v2](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-configure-cli): Configure Azure ML CLI
- [CLI Reference](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/reference-azure-machine-learning-cli): CLI command reference
- [CI/CD Pipelines](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-github-actions-machine-learning): GitHub Actions for ML

### Best Practices
- [MLOps](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-model-management-and-deployment): MLOps with Azure ML
- [Cost Management](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-manage-optimize-cost): Optimize Azure ML costs
- [Performance Optimization](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-train-with-datasets): Training performance tips

### Troubleshooting
- [Common Issues](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-troubleshoot-online-endpoints): Troubleshoot deployments
- [Debug Pipelines](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-debug-pipelines): Debug pipeline failures
- [Quota Management](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-manage-quotas): Manage compute quotas

## Key Concepts

### Workspace
The top-level resource for Azure Machine Learning, providing a centralized place to work with all artifacts.

### Compute
Various compute resources for training and inference including clusters, instances, and serverless compute.

### Data Assets
Versioned references to data in storage locations, making data reproducible and reusable.

### Models
Trained machine learning models that can be registered, versioned, and deployed.

### Environments
Docker-based environments that specify software dependencies for training and inference.

### Pipelines
Workflows that chain together data preparation, training, and deployment steps.

### Endpoints
Deployment targets for models, supporting both real-time and batch inference.

## Common Tasks

1. **Create Workspace**: Set up Azure ML workspace
2. **Prepare Data**: Create and register data assets
3. **Define Environment**: Specify dependencies
4. **Train Model**: Submit training jobs
5. **Register Model**: Version and track models
6. **Deploy Model**: Create online or batch endpoints
7. **Monitor Performance**: Track metrics and logs

## Integration Points

- **MLflow**: Open-source platform for ML lifecycle
- **Azure DevOps**: CI/CD integration
- **GitHub Actions**: Automated workflows
- **Azure Monitor**: Logging and monitoring
- **Azure Key Vault**: Secrets management
- **Azure Container Registry**: Docker images
- **Azure Storage**: Data storage

## SDK Examples

### Python SDK v2
```python
from azure.ai.ml import MLClient
from azure.identity import DefaultAzureCredential

ml_client = MLClient(
    DefaultAzureCredential(),
    subscription_id="<subscription>",
    resource_group_name="<resource-group>",
    workspace_name="<workspace>"
)
```

### CLI v2
```bash
az ml job create --file job.yml
az ml model create --file model.yml
az ml online-endpoint create --file endpoint.yml
```
